p: In 2004, the plasmid-based infectious clone NV FL101 (based on the 1968 Norwalk strain) was established, which contained the cDNA of the full virus genome under the control of the T7 promoter [91]. Based on NV FL101, Chang et al. established a replicon by replacing the majority of the VP1 coding region with the neomycin phosphotransferase ( npt) gene ( Fig. 1e). Transfection of BHK cells expressing T7 polymerase with the replicon-coding plasmid resulted in cell lines that maintained the replicon under G-418 selection. The replicon could then be transferred to Huh-7 cells by RNA extraction and transfection with the resulting RNA, and maintained for 100 passages under G-418 selection [92].
